pageContext.claim: “Well the other thing we've done is, uh, thank you to President Obama, he was unable to get anybody approved. He waited so long, and we had a little help, too, in the Senate, to put it mildly -- but he waited so long, you know, if you go early enough, you'll get 'em through, and we ended up with 142 Federal Judges, and -- but that's nothing.”
pageContext.analysis: There were 88 district and 17 court of appeals vacancies when Trump took office, so a total of 105 -- not through Obama's lack of effort. Senate Republicans refused to move on his nominations.
